      Great stay!
      We stayed at Charlie’s for 10 days, and each day was perfect. The entire staff from the front desk, restaurant and housekeeping are all very friendly and professional. We had time to check out their restaurant at different times from breakfast to dinner and each time was delicious. Our stay had free buffet-style breakfast and they had good options ranging from continental breakfast items, traditional Filipino breakfast foods , and an omelette bar. They also have happy hour with buy 1 get 1 drinks from 2PM-6PM which we thought was quite long! Their signature mojito was my favorite. Our room was cleaned daily and everything was done well. We were very comfortable in our bed and the balcony in our Premium suite was perfect for relaxing in the morning and sunsets. We had a great stay! Highly recommend!…

      Mystic W wrote a review May 2022
      Taguig City, Philippines200 contributions7 helpful votes
      +1
      Overated hotel - beautiful on the outside, poor facilities and services, not beachfront, very far from the main action
      Nice building with a picturesque view in a quiet side of El Nido near Lio AirPort (6 minutes drive) and Lio Beach. But it’s far from the main action at El Nido town and Corong-Corong. If the limited schedule of shuttles provided does not jive with your schedule, be prepared to shell out P300 for each 20-minute tricycle ride. The staff is a mixed crew: some are competent and very accommodating (Raster - concierge; Peter - head of house keeping; Nace and JR - frontdesk; the staff at the breakfast buffet); while others need further training. They try to please, though, and would try to make amends immediately in their shortcomings brought to their attention. For example, upon check-in, the Supervisor offered to book me for a massage at the hotel’s spa. When I went there at the appointed time, the Spa head said there was no booking and so I wasnt’ accommodated. The Supervisor was in denial the next day that he was the one who made the booking, but upon investigation later on admitted his mistake and offered to make up for it. The room does not have slippers; you have to bring your own. There’s no minibar. Bottled water provided in the room is only a single 330 ml for each pax. They will bring you a jug of service water upon request. There’s no electric kettle so you cannot enjoy coffee or tea in your room. The TV does seem to tune in to one single channel. It’s a Smart TV, though, so if you press Netflix, you can choose from the saved accounts of the room’s previous occupants! Lighting inside the room is inadequate and kinda dark. What seemed like a big room in their website is very small. The toilet will sometimes give off an overpowering smell of raw sewage. I checked with the staff who admitted they’re fixing the plumbing. The towels are also kinda wet and seemed to have been recycled or not thoroughly dried. Food at the breakfast buffet is average. Coffee is bad. It gradually improved each day after I complained. Stay in this beautiful-looking hotel at your own risk. I suppose there are better options with better facilities and services at El Nido town or Corong-Corong.…

      Response from Ed Franco , General Manager at Charlie's El Nido
      Responded 1 week ago
      Dear Mystic W, Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. You’ve given us some valuable information and shown us where we need to improve. We've taken this to heart and it will be given utmost attention in our continuous efforts to improve service to our guests. What’s unique about Charlie’s El Nido is we provide daily complimentary airport shuttle and a daily schedule for our guest transfers going to Lio Beach and El Nido town proper. No other hotel in El Nido provide a regular shuttle service like we do. The highlighted concerns about our staff service, the room and its amenities including the coffee served at the restaurant have all been taken up with the concerned departments. Rest assured all these will be addressed properly. While it is unfortunate that you find our superior rooms too small, we hope you will give us a chance to offer you our popular deluxe rooms with pool access and premier rooms on your future travel here in El Nido. We want our guest to leave with a good first impression and experience. Your comments mean a lot to us as they help us continually strive for improvement. We hope we will be given another opportunity to regain your confidence next time you stay at Charlie’s El Nido. With Kind Regards,

      Juvy Andrea R wrote a review May 2022
      2 contributions
      El Nido is amazing as it is, and Charlie' El Nido definitely elevated the experience!
      This is our first time to travel in Palawan and we chose to stay at El Nido because of their work-and-play package. We needed a stable internet connection as we had to do some work some days of our trip - and they didn't fail us on this one. While there were instances that my internet connection gets erratic (not sure if it's my laptop as my phone's connection was great the whole time), you can still rely on your mobile data and it works just fine even for a video call! We were welcomed with the best mojito in the island (yep, for me at the very least). For seven days, we enjoyed the pool, the gym and the spa! Our room is spacious, clean and complete with the toiletries that I loved as well. Everyday we would have Charlie's buffet breakfast and was also great. Not a lot of vegetarian options for vegetarians out there, but for the rest, I'm sure you'll enjoy it too. They change the several of the menu everyday. I'd say Charlie's being a bit away from Downtown (15 to 20 mins via tricycle) only added to right balance of peace and quiet. While you enjoy the pool, you can also take the time the appreciate the place's architecture! Aesthetics are on point everywhere you look! Charlie's really crafted the perfect vacation place and I someone who stayed with them, I tell you this, if you're looking for a place in El Nido, do yourself a favor and check Charlie's!…

      Our first time in El Nido and the islands, beach and rock formations are so amazing and enchanting! We stayed for 3 nights and 4 days at Charlie’s Hotel, not Lio beach front, but just a few mins shuttle ride to and from the airport and Lio beach. The hotel and its pools are nice. We booked 1 Superior Twin room and 1 Superior Queen room but were given 2 Twin rooms at the lower ground floor. The superior rooms were small, with 2 single beds but with huge cable tv. Bathroom is ok, but it would have been better if the shower cubicle is fully enclosed so floor by the toilet bowl does not get wet. We were out most of the days so we did not push to be transferred to a queen bed room. Perhaps the upper floor rooms are better as there’s foul smell in the bathroom of our rooms. Food at their resto is good. Staff are courteous and observe proper health and safety protocols. We took Tours A and C for 2 days. Overall, we had an amazing adventure at El Nido.…
